author: stsp
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db_update_move.c
(update_moved_away_subtree): Rename local variables child_relpath and
child_moved_to_relpath to child_src_relpath and child_dst_relpath,
respectively. No functional change.

author: mduerig
msg: OAK-418: Reduce/avoid re-resolving the underlying tree instances on every access in Item/Property/NodeDelegate

author: ggregory
msg: Allow custom ANSI mappings for Levels using a STYLE options: STYLE can be one of Default or Logback.

author: dkulp
msg: [CXF-4572] Support a negotiation for the GZIP

author: stsp
msg: Remove a redundant and wrong scan_addition call from the move-update editor.
Before this commit, the editor driver was obtaining the copyfrom revision
of a moved-away file with scan_addition, which won't return the correct
result for files which were replaced after being moved. Instead, assume
the revision of the move op-root, which will be correct unless the user
runs 'svn move --allow-mixed-revisions'. This is fine since we're currently
working under the assumption that only single-rev move tree-conflicts will
be resolvable automatically in Subversion 1.8.
The driver also verified whether the file does exist in the move destination
as per scan_addition(), which is a redundant check since the file must be
part of the move by definition.
Also, change the receiver's assumption that paths are relative to the move
destination op-root. Make it expect paths relative to the wcroot instead.
(Only one receiver has been partly implemented so far so it is trivial
to make this change as part of this commit.)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db_update_move.c
(tc_editor_alter_file): Expect a destination relpath which is relative
to the wcroot abspath, rather than relative to the move destination
op-root. Convert from read_info() to read_info_internal(), using a
wcroot and relpath pair instead of a db and an abspath.
Also move the moved_to_abspath local variable into a tighter scope.
(update_moved_away_file): Rename moved_to_relpath parameter to dst_relpath.
Add move_dst_op_root_revision parameter which corresponds to the copyfrom
revision used when the move was performed (i.e. from before the update),
and communicate that revision number to the receiver.
Don't call scan_addition() and read_info() on the move destination file,
as explained above.
(update_moved_away_dir): Parameters change as for update_moved_away_file().
This function is currently a no-op so nothing really changes here.
(update_moved_away_subtree): Rename moved_to_relpath parameter to dst_relpath.
Add move_dst_op_root_revision parameter and pass it through.
(drive_tree_conflict_editor): Provide the pre-update revision of the move
op-root to update_moved_away_file() and update_moved_away_subtree().
